metadata.title: Discourse studies in Mesoamerican languages 1: Discussion

publishingInfo.publisher: SIL and the University of Texas at Arlington

sources.title: Summer Institute of Linguistics Publications in Linguistics

metadata.freeKeywords: LoC Class: PM3027, LoC Subject Headings: Indians of Central America--Languages

abstracts.value:
Contains: 'A discourse particle in Cajonos Zapotec'  by Jones, Larry B. and Donald G. Nellis // 'Dynamics of reported speech in Totonac' by Reid, Aileen A // 'Tense, tense embedding, and theme in discourse in Mazatec of Jalapa de Diaz' by Schram, Terry L // 'Rank of participants in Huasteca Nahuatl' by Beller, Richard and Patricia Beller // 'Verbal suffixes of prominence in Western Tarahumara narrative discourse' by Burgess, Donald H // 'Highlighting in Aguacatec discourse'  by McArthur, Lucille E // 'Theme in a Mazatec story' by Schram, Terry L // 'Participant reference in narrative discourse in Mazatec of Jalapa de Diaz' by Schram, Judith L. and Linda K. Jones // 'The role of aspect in distinguishing Aguacatec discourse types' by McArthur, Harry S // 'Prominence and dominance in Coatzospan Mixtec narrative' by Small, Priscilla C //
'Tense-aspect in Totonac narrative discourse' by Bishop, Ruth G // 'Plot structure in Lachixio Zapotec discourse' by Persons, David // 'Multiple levels of information in discourse' by Jones, Larry B. and Linda K. Jones // 'Towards a discourse perspective of modes and tenses in Kickapoo narratives' by Jones, Linda K. and Ned R. Coleman
